de.frauas.jdemandmodel.util

Class JDMFileCreator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.frauas.jdemandmodel.util.JDMFileCreator

  • public class JDMFileCreator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates a file from simulated data.
    Author:
    lukas

    • Constructor Detail

      • JDMFileCreator

        public JDMFileCreator(Matrix data,
                      Device[] devices)
        Creates a new JDMFileCreator. The compliance of the data's size with the number of devices is checked, then header string and data string are set internally.
        Parameters:
        data - the simulation data
        devices - the devices used for the simulation

    • Method Detail

      • getHeaderString

        private java.lang.String getHeaderString(Device[] devices)
        Builds a header string from the devices used.
        Parameters:
        devices - device to appear in the header
        Returns:
        one string representing the header of the CSV file including a line break.

      • createNewFile

        public void createNewFile(java.lang.String filename)
        This method creates a new file. If the file already exists, the program will terminate.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name under which the file should be saved.

      • writeHeaderAndDataTo

        private void writeHeaderAndDataTo(java.io.File file)
        Writes the header and data string to the specified file. If the file (and directory) doesn't exist, creates a new one.
        Parameters:
        file - file to write the data to
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the passed file holds an invalid filename, e. g. containing ?, | or \.

      • checkCompliance

        private void checkCompliance(int dataSize,
                             int devicesCount)
        This method checks whether the size of the given data fits the number of devices that were specified. The data size must equal the number of device plus three, because the data should contain columns for occupancy, total demand and lighting.
        Parameters:
        dataSize - size of the data matrix
        devicesCount - number of devices to be included in the header
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if data size and device count do not comply
